intro: Geissorhiza graminifolia, commonly known as the grassland lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and delicate, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its blooming period occurs during the cooler months, and it produces small, colorful flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
